identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of Continuous Infusions of HNO (Nitroxyl) Donor in Patients With Heart Failure and Impaired Systolic Function
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo- and Active-Controlled, Cross-over Phase 2 Study of Continuous 5-Hour Intravenous Infusions of BMS-986231 in Patients With Heart Failure and Impaired Systolic Function

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on systolic and diastolic parameters in patients with heart failure and low ejection fraction.

armGroups.label: Placebo/BMS-986231/NTG
armGroups.description: administered in a cross over design with 5-hour infusions and 5-28 day wash-out periods

armGroups.label: Placebo/NTG/BMS-986231
armGroups.description: administered in a cross over design with 5-hour infusions and 5-28 day wash-out periods

armGroups.label: NTG/Placebo/BMS-986231
armGroups.description: administered in a cross over design with 5-hour infusions and 5-28 day wash-out periods

armGroups.label: NTG/BMS-986231/Placebo
armGroups.description: administered in a cross over design with 5-hour infusions and 5-28 day wash-out periods

armGroups.label: BMS-986231/Placebo/NTG
armGroups.description: administered in a cross over design with 5-hour infusions and 5-28 day wash-out periods

armGroups.label: BMS-986231/NTG/Placebo
armGroups.description: administered in a cross over design with 5-hour infusions and 5-28 day wash-out periods

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Stroke Volume Index (SVI) Derived From the Velocity Time Integral at the Left Ventricular Outflow Tract (LVOT VTI) at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus Placebo
primaryOutcomes.description: The objective is to evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on the left ventricular (LV) systolic function by stroke volume index (SVI) assessed by echocardiography compared to placebo.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean SVI Derived From LVOT VTI at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus NTG
secondaryOutcomes.description: The objective is to evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on the left ventricular (LV) systolic function by stroke volume index (SVI) assessed by echocardiography compared to NTG.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean LVEF, Computed by Simpson's Method at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus Placebo and NTG
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on selected other left ventricular systolic and diastolic indices compared to placebo and NTG:

LV ejection fraction
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Cardiac Power Index at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus Placebo and NTG
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on selected other left ventricular systolic and diastolic indices compared to placebo and NTG:

Mean LV power index
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Diastolic Indices: E/A and E/e' Ratio at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus Placebo and NTG
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on selected other left ventricular systolic and diastolic indices compared to placebo and NTG:

Diastolic function
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Diastolic Indices: Annular e' Velocity at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus Placebo and NTG
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on selected other left ventricular systolic and diastolic indices compared to placebo and NTG:

Diastolic function
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean LV Global Longitudinal Strain, Computed Using STE at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus Placebo and NTG
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on selected other left ventricular systolic and diastolic indices compared to placebo and NTG:

LV global longitudinal strain
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com

Inclusion Criteria:

* Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (LVEF on echocardiogram of 40% or less)
* Stable guideline directed therapy for heart failure including oral diuretics, ACEi, ARBs, ARNi, MRAs, and β blockers as tolerated, with no dose changes of these medications in the past 2 weeks
* Have screening values of NT pro-BNP ≥ 125 pg/mL (15 pmol/L) or BNP ≥ 35 pg/mL (10 pmol/L)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Systolic blood pressure (SBP) \< 110 mm Hg at screening or pre-randomization
* Heart rate \< 50 beats per minute (bpm) or \> 90 bpm at screening or pre-randomization
* Permanent Atrial Fibrillation, Atrial Flutter or having Atrial Fibrillation, Atrial Flutter
* Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) \< 15 ml/min/1.73 m2
* Ventricular assist device or prior heart transplant
* Prior solid organ transplant
* Body weight \< 45 kg or ≥ 140 kg
* Low quality echocardiographic visualization windows and image acquisition
* Permanent paced rhythm (VVI, DDD or BiV pacing)

Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply

locations.facility: Duke Advanced Heart and Lung Failure Clinic

references.citation: Felker GM, Borentain M, Cleland JG, DeSouza MM, Kessler PD, O'Connor CM, Seiffert D, Teerlink JR, Voors AA, McMurray JJV. Rationale and design for the development of a novel nitroxyl donor in patients with acute heart failure. Eur J Heart Fail. 2019 Aug;21(8):1022-1031. doi: 10.1002/ejhf.1504. Epub 2019 Jun 6.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails:
49 participants assigned to treatment and 45 treated. Reasons not treated: 2 re-randomized; 1 randomized in error, screen failure; 1 no longer met study criteria.

Note: Study designed for all participants to enter all 3 arms (reassignment of arms occurs every period change).

groups.title: Sequence 1
groups.description:
Participants crossed-over from one therapy to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period.

3 treatments were given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods, 1 treatment per period. Treatments were as follows: Placebo (PBO) BMS-986231 (drug) Nitroglycerin (NTG)

Sequence of treatment for this group is as follows: PBO-drug-NTG

groups.title: Sequence 2
groups.description:
Participants crossed-over from one therapy to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period.

3 treatments were given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods, 1 treatment per period. Treatments were as follows: Placebo (PBO) BMS-986231 (drug) Nitroglycerin (NTG)

Sequence of treatment for this group is as follows: PBO-NTG-drug

groups.title: Sequence 3
groups.description:
Participants crossed-over from one therapy to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period.

3 treatments were given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods, 1 treatment per period. Treatments were as follows: Placebo (PBO) BMS-986231 (drug) Nitroglycerin (NTG)

Sequence of treatment for this group is as follows: NTG-PBO-drug

groups.title: Sequence 4
groups.description:
Participants crossed-over from one therapy to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period.

3 treatments were given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods, 1 treatment per period. Treatments were as follows: Placebo (PBO) BMS-986231 (drug) Nitroglycerin (NTG)

Sequence of treatment for this group is as follows: NTG-drug-PBO

groups.title: Sequence 5
groups.description:
Participants crossed-over from one therapy to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period.

3 treatments were given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods, 1 treatment per period. Treatments were as follows: Placebo (PBO) BMS-986231 (drug) Nitroglycerin (NTG)

Sequence of treatment for this group is as follows: drug-PBO-NTG

groups.title: Sequence 6
groups.description:
Participants crossed-over from one therapy to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period.

3 treatments were given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods, 1 treatment per period. Treatments were as follows: Placebo (PBO) BMS-986231 (drug) Nitroglycerin (NTG)

Sequence of treatment for this group is as follows: drug-NTG-PBO

achievements.comment: 1 withdrew post-P1 completion/prior to P2 therapy due to acute cholecystitis, but returned for P2/P3
1 discontinued P1 due to acute bradycardia and hypotension
1 discontinued P1 due to hypotension but resumed P2/P3

1 completed P1, did not proceed to P2/P3 (lost to follow-up);

1 discontinued P2 due to hypotension
1 only completed P1, did not continue to P2/P3 (withdrew consent due to personal reasons)
1 discontinued P2 due to an Adverse Event (AE)

dropWithdraws.type: Withdrew consent due to personal reasons

groups.title: Overall Participants
groups.description: Inclusive of all treatments, all periods. Note: Participants crossed-over from either placebo, drug or NTG arm to the next (in various sequence) following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period, per arm.

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Stroke Volume Index (SVI) Derived From the Velocity Time Integral at the Left Ventricular Outflow Tract (LVOT VTI) at the End of the 5-hour Infusion of BMS-986231, Versus Placebo
outcomeMeasures.description: The objective is to evaluate the effects of BMS-986231 on the left ventricular (LV) systolic function by stroke volume index (SVI) assessed by echocardiography compared to placebo.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Intent to Treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants who started study drug infusion in at least one treatment period.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at the end of the 5-hour infusion

groups.title: Placebo (PBO)
groups.description:
Placebo-matching treatment. Note: Participants crossed-over from one arm to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period, per arm.

Treatment was given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods. Participant therapy sequence assignment varies as follows:

PBO-drug-NTG, PBO-NTG-drug, NTG-PBO-drug, NTG-drug-PBO, drug-PBO-NTG, drug-NTG-PBO

groups.title: BMS-986231
groups.description:
BMS-986231: 3 μg/kg/min for 10 min, followed by 6 μg/kg/min for 10 min, followed by 12 μg/kg/min for the rest of the 5-hour infusion.

Note: Participants crossed-over from one arm to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period, per arm.

Treatment was given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods. Participant therapy sequence assignment varies as follows:

PBO-drug-NTG, PBO-NTG-drug, NTG-PBO-drug, NTG-drug-PBO, drug-PBO-NTG, drug-NTG-PBO

groups.title: Nitroglycerin (NTG)
groups.description:
NTG: 20 μg/min for 10 min, followed by 40 μg/min for 10 min, followed by 80 μg/min for the rest of the 5-hour infusion Note: Participants crossed-over from one arm to the next following Day 1 treatment and a minimum 5-day washout period, per arm.

Treatment was given via 1 of 6 different order sequences across 3 total treatment periods. Participant therapy sequence assignment varies as follows:

PBO-drug-NTG, PBO-NTG-drug, NTG-PBO-drug, NTG-drug-PBO, drug-PBO-NTG, drug-NTG-PBO

analyses.statisticalComment: Kenward-Roger degree of freedom is used to adjust the standard error of treatment effect
analyses.estimateComment: The modelled mean difference uses treatment sequence and difference of baselines as a covariates of the treatment effect.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: From first dose to 30 days post last dose (approximately 3 months)
